page.title: 07POLLUTION
page.content: Grave concern is felt in the area about pollution from the industrial complex one mile west of Calf Heath comprising three major chemicals factories. Villagers are worried about the possible health hazard of inhaling toxic fumes and annoyed by the fallout of sooty carbon particles.The major concern is the possible carcinogenic effects of fumes from a tyre processing plant.An investigation by a government air pollution expert is at present under way,and villagers are holding their own survey spearheaded by a local action committee.A calendar of noxious smells and fallout is being compiled by householders within a three mile radius,although complaints have been received from Stafford lO miles north and Lichfield lO miles south respectively.
